levels.title: What is Phishing?
levels.content: Phishing is a cyber attack where attackers trick people into giving away sensitive information, such as passwords or credit card numbers, usually by pretending to be a trustworthy source via email or message.

levels.title: Types of Phishing Attacks
levels.content: Common phishing types include email phishing, spear phishing (targeted), smishing (SMS phishing), and vishing (voice phishing). Each method uses different channels to deceive the victim.

levels.question: Which of the following is an example of phishing?
options: An email claiming you won a prize, asking for personal info

levels.title: How to Spot a Phishing Attempt
levels.content: Look for signs like poor grammar, suspicious links, unexpected attachments, and urgent or threatening language. Always verify the sender and avoid clicking unknown links.

levels.question: What is a sign of a phishing email?
options: It uses perfect grammar and clear language
It comes from your saved contacts
It asks for urgent action and contains a suspicious link
It is sent through secure channels

questions.question: What is phishing?
options: A fake message trying to steal information

questions.question: Which of these is NOT a form of phishing?
options: Voice call pretending to be tech support

questions.question: How can you protect yourself from phishing?
options: Click all links to check them
Verify sources and avoid clicking unknown links
